byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from the United Nations, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.
byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

abstract: United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-Moon accuses parties in Syrian conflict of war crimes by denying food to starving civilians; aid delivery trucks recently given access to besieged Syrian towns found dire humanitarian situation, prompting secretary's pointed call for immediate end to sieges.
lead_paragraph: As aid convoys reached three besieged towns in Syria, Secretary General Ban Ki-moon called on all sides to lift sieges and protect civilians.

headline.main: As Aid Reaches Syrians, U.N. Chief Says Withholding Food Is a War Crime
headline.print_headline: Preventing Food From Reaching Syrian Civilians Is a War Crime, U.N. Says

snippet: As aid convoys reached three besieged towns in Syria, Secretary General Ban Ki-moon called on all sides to lift sieges and protect civilians.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: International Committee of the Red Cross
